appsgate.lig.clock.sensor.spec
Interface CoreClockSpec

All Known Implementing Classes:
appsgate.lig.clock.sensor.impl.ConfigurableClockImpl, SwingClockImpl
public interface CoreClockSpec

This java interface is an ApAM specification shared by all ApAM AppsGate application to provide current Time and Date information

Method Summary
 java.util.Calendar getCurrentDate()
           
 long getCurrentTimeInMillis()
           
 double getTimeFlowRate()
          Get the current time flow rate
 void goAlongUntil(long millis)
          Sets a date in the future, events between old time and the new one (currentTime + millis) WILL be thrown.
 int registerAlarm(java.util.Calendar calendar, AlarmEventObserver observer)
          register a new Alarm at specified calendar date
 void resetClock()
          Reset the clock to the current local System Time and default speed frequency (1), remove all alarm registered
 void setCurrentDate(java.util.Calendar calendar)
          Set a date (might be real or simulated), if date is in the future : events between old time and the setted value will NOT be thrown
 void setCurrentTimeInMillis(long millis)
          Sets the clock from the given long value.
 double setTimeFlowRate(double rate)
          Sets the time flow rate (to speed-up or slow down time events)
 void unregisterAlarm(int alarmEventId)
          Unregister a previously alarm setted
 

Method Detail

getCurrentDate

java.util.Calendar getCurrentDate()
Returns:
a Calendar object whose calendar fields have been initialized with the current date and time

getCurrentTimeInMillis

long getCurrentTimeInMillis()
Returns:
the current time as UTC milliseconds from the epoch (January 1, 1970 00:00:00.000 GMT )

getTimeFlowRate

double getTimeFlowRate()
Get the current time flow rate

Returns:
the time flow rate as a double

setCurrentDate

void setCurrentDate(java.util.Calendar calendar)
Set a date (might be real or simulated), if date is in the future : events between old time and the setted value will NOT be thrown

Parameters:
a - Calendar object whose calendar fields have been initialized with the desired date and time

setCurrentTimeInMillis

void setCurrentTimeInMillis(long millis)
Sets the clock from the given long value. if date is in the future : events between old time and the setted value will NOT be thrown

Parameters:
millis - the time as UTC milliseconds from the epoch (January 1, 1970 00:00:00.000 GMT )

goAlongUntil

void goAlongUntil(long millis)
Sets a date in the future, events between old time and the new one (currentTime + millis) WILL be thrown.

Parameters:
millis - the amount of millis to add to current time (3600 0000 is one hour later)

registerAlarm

int registerAlarm(java.util.Calendar calendar,
                  AlarmEventObserver observer)
register a new Alarm at specified calendar date

Parameters:
calendar - The date when clock event must be generated
observer - The observer that must be called
Returns:
An unique identifier for the Alarm (allow unregister and distinction between multiple alarm for a single observer) or -1 if registration impossible

unregisterAlarm

void unregisterAlarm(int alarmEventId)
Unregister a previously alarm setted

Parameters:
alarmEventId - the Id that has been generated on alarm registration

setTimeFlowRate

double setTimeFlowRate(double rate)
Sets the time flow rate (to speed-up or slow down time events)

Parameters:
rate - Default is "1" (real time), if inferior to "1", simulated time will flow slower (0,5 means that a day will be done in 48 hrs), if superior to "1", simulated time will flow faster (2 means than a day will be done in 12 hrs) if less or equal to "0", value is invalid and will not be taken into account
Returns:
the setted time flow (best effort: might be different from the desired value, depends on the implementation and the hardware possibilities)

resetClock

void resetClock()
Reset the clock to the current local System Time and default speed frequency (1), remove all alarm registered
